Burbank.John Anson Ford Amphitheatre:
The John Anson Ford Theatres complex is situated in the Cahuenga Pass in Hollywood, California, and consists of a 1,200-seat outdoor amphitheatre. Located in a County regional park, the facility is owned by the County of Los Angeles and operated in partnership with the Ford Theatre Foundation and the Los Angeles County Department of Parks and Recreation.


== History ==


=== Christine Wetherill Stevenson and The Pilgrimage Play ===
John Anson Ford Amphitheatre was built in 1920 as the site of The Pilgrimage Play.
